bibliography:
On Pythagoreanism, including:

 On the Pythagorean Life (De Vita
Pythagorica)
 Protrepticus 
 On General Mathematical Science
 Introduction to Arithmetic, based on Nicomachus of
Gerasa’s work of the same name

On the Pythagorean Life (De Vita
Pythagorica)
Protrepticus
On General Mathematical Science

Introduction to Arithmetic, based on Nicomachus of
Gerasa’s work of the same name

[Reply to Porphyry] Reply of Master Abamon to
Porphyry’s Letter to Anebo, and Solutions to the Difficulties
Contained Therein. Also known as De mysteriis
Ægyptiorum (On the Egyptian Mysteries).

The anonymous compilation on number symbolism known
as Theologoumena arithmeticae, sometimes attributed to
Iamblichus, is not by him (see O’Meara 1989: 15 n. 24).

On Pythagoreanism, including:

 Arithmetic in Physical matters
 Arithmetic in Ethical matters
 Arithmetic in Theological matters, all excerpts
 edited by O’Meara 1989: 217–229 from Michael Psellus
Arithmetic in Physical matters
Arithmetic in Ethical matters

Arithmetic in Theological matters, all excerpts
 edited by O’Meara 1989: 217–229 from Michael Psellus
On the Soul

Various Letters including to Macedonius, Sopater,
Dexippus

Commentaries on Aristotle:
 Categories, transmitted by Simplicius
 Prior Analytics
 On the Heavens (dubious)
Categories, transmitted by Simplicius
Prior Analytics
On the Heavens (dubious)

  Timaeus, transmitted by Proclus
  Alcibiades
  Phaedo
  Phaedrus
  Philebus
  Parmenides

That reincarnations do not occur from men to irrational
animals, nor from irrational animals to men
On choosing the best discourse
Refutations of Numenius and Amelius

Iamblichus: De Mysteriis (Writings from the Greco-Roman

fragment number.)

number.)
